text: <a href="../2-Corinthians-3-1/" title="2 Corinthians 3:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some *others*, epistles of commendation to you, or *letters* of commendation from you?
<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-2/" title="2 Corinthians 3:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-3/" title="2 Corinthians 3:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 *Forasmuch as ye are* manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-4/" title="2 Corinthians 3:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-5/" title="2 Corinthians 3:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency *is* of God;

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-6/" title="2 Corinthians 3:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-7/" title="2 Corinthians 3:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 But if the ministration of death, written *and* engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which *glory* was to be done away:
<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-8/" title="2 Corinthians 3:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-9/" title="2 Corinthians 3:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 For if the ministration of condemnation *be* glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-10/" title="2 Corinthians 3:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-11/" title="2 Corinthians 3:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 For if that which is done away *was* glorious, much more that which remaineth *is* glorious.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-12/" title="2 Corinthians 3:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-13/" title="2 Corinthians 3:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And not as Moses, *which* put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-14/" title="2 Corinthians 3:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which *vail* is done away in Christ.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-15/" title="2 Corinthians 3:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-16/" title="2 Corinthians 3:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-17/" title="2 Corinthians 3:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord *is*, there *is* liberty.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-3-18/" title="2 Corinthians 3:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, *even* as by the Spirit of the Lord.
